description: Stops automated backup replication for a DB instance. This command doesn't apply to RDS Custom, Aurora MySQL, and Aurora PostgreSQL. For more information, see Replicating Automated Backups to Another Amazon Web Services Region in the Amazon RDS User Guide.

parameters.name: SourceDBInstanceArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the source DB instance for which to stop replicating automate backups, for example, arn:aws:rds:us-west-2:123456789012:db:mydatabase.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceAutomatedBackup
nested_items.description: An automated backup of a DB instance. It consists of system backups, transaction logs, and the database instance properties that existed at the time you deleted the source instance.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the automated backups.

nested_items.name: DbiResourceId
nested_items.description: The resource ID for the source DB instance, which can't be changed and which is unique to an Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region associated with the automated backup.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The identifier for the source DB instance, which can't be changed and which is unique to an Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: RestoreWindow
nested_items.description: The earliest and latest time a DB instance can be restored to.

nested_items.name: EarliestTime
nested_items.description: The earliest time you can restore an instance to.

nested_items.name: LatestTime
nested_items.description: The latest time you can restore an instance to.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: The allocated storage size for the the automated backup in gibibytes (GiB).

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: A list of status information for an automated backup:
active - Automated backups for current instances.
retained - Automated backups for deleted instances.
creating - Automated backups that are waiting for the first automated snapshot to be available.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: The port number that the automated backup used for connections.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone that the automated backup was created in. For information on Amazon Web Services Regions and Availability Zones, see Regions and Availability Zones.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The VPC ID associated with the DB instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceCreateTime
nested_items.description: The date and time when the DB instance was created.

nested_items.name: MasterUsername
nested_items.description: The master user name of an automated backup.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: The name of the database engine for this automated backup.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the database engine for the automated backup.

nested_items.name: LicenseModel
nested_items.description: The license model information for the automated backup.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The IOPS (I/O operations per second) value for the automated backup.

nested_items.name: OptionGroupName
nested_items.description: The option group the automated backup is associated with. If omitted, the default option group for the engine specified is used.

nested_items.name: TdeCredentialArn
nested_items.description: The ARN from the key store with which the automated backup is associated for TDE encryption.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the automated backup is encrypted.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: The storage type associated with the automated backup.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services KMS key ID for an automated backup.

nested_items.name: Timezone
nested_items.description: The time zone of the automated backup. In most cases, the Timezone element is empty. Timezone content appears only for Microsoft SQL Server DB instances that were created with a time zone specified.

nested_items.name: IAMDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled
nested_items.description: True if mapping of Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts is enabled, and otherwise false.

nested_items.name: BackupRetentionPeriod
nested_items.description: The retention period for the automated backups.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceAutomatedBackupsArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the replicated automated backups.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceAutomatedBackupsReplications
nested_items.description: The list of replications to different Amazon Web Services Regions associated with the automated backup.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceAutomatedBackupsArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the replicated automated backups.

nested_items.name: BackupTarget
nested_items.description: The location where automated backups are stored: Dedicated Local Zones, Amazon Web Services Outposts or the Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: StorageThroughput
nested_items.description: The storage throughput for the automated backup.

nested_items.name: AwsBackupRecoveryPointArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the recovery point in Amazon Web Services Backup.

nested_items.name: DedicatedLogVolume
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB instance has a dedicated log volume (DLV) enabled.

nested_items.name: MultiTenant
nested_items.description: Specifies whether the automatic backup is for a DB instance in the multi-tenant configuration (TRUE) or the single-tenant configuration (FALSE).
